White light not like the old dim yellow ones from long ago so if you are looking for nostalgia this won't do. Plenty bright for locating, you couldn't read by it. I used to keep a low wattage light going all the time in the basement just so I could find the light switch now I don't have to.

reviews.text: I bought this illuminated switch for our first floor powder room. When we have guests visiting, this is the restroom that they use. It is a room without a window, so it is dark even in the middle of the day. I found that many of our guests fumble around looking for the light switch, so I installed this. No problem find the switch now. I had looked at my regular big box store for a switch like this one but could not find one. Amazon had what I was looking for at a very low price. My daughter liked it so much she wanted one for her house, as well. I just installed hers today.

reviews.text: In olden days these contained a neon light, which usually died in a few years. So this is a big improvement in life expectancy. However the switch bat is clear which makes it a bit harder to see from the side. A significant improvement would be to make the switch bat a slightly opaque, so it scattered the light internally; this would make it easier to see from the side. Took off one star for this design deficiency.

So far so good. Will update if any problems.

I don't know why I keep buying them; should probably look for something else. These are terrible switches. I have them in my garage because you can see them in the dark. Doesn't do much good when the lights don't turn on.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2024
reviews.title: Doesn't last

reviews.text: I installed this switch in my shed, and was happy with it. Less than a month after installation I flipped it on, and nothing. I flipped it off and on several times, the switch made a crackling sound internally, and the lights flickered, and then went off. The switch itself is still illuminated, but no longer functions as a light switch. I bought this specifically because it was Levithon brand, but it appears that I was bitten. Others may have a different experience, but I can't recommend this product.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2024
reviews.title: Failed after less than a month.

reviews.text: Purchased this to use for Panasonic bathroom fan with built-in LED light. When this switch is in "off" position - it still leaks enough current to slightly light up the LED light panel in the bathroom fan. I don't know if it is an intended design, but personally I believe it is a needless waste of electricity - I don't need the LED light panel inside the bathroom fan to be always on when I'm not using the bathroom.

reviews.title: Nice switch Night lighted wall switch

reviews.text: This is my second of these switches that I've purchased in the past year. Installed it as the light switch in my garage. I chose the illuminated switch because I don't have windows there, and I was tired of fumbling around searching for the switch in the dark. After about 6 months, the first of these switches stopped working. The switch itself would illuminate, but no matter how many times I flipped the switch, the garage lights would not come on. Troubleshot with a standard switch and the lights worked just fine. Okay, no biggie...things fail. It wasn't too costly, so I'll just buy another one. Second switch was delivered, I installed it. Tried it while still hanging out of the wall by the wires. The switch illuminated, the lights came on when switched. Issue resolved....NOT! Pulled the circuit breaker once again, tucked the wires in, secured the switch and installed the switchplate. Reset the circuit breaker, tried the switch again, all worked just fine. Went in the house and returned to the garage a few minutes later....waitaminnit!!! The switch isn't illuminating! What the...? Jiggled the switch a bit, and it illuminates while in the "in-between" position between Off and On, but that is the only time. Now I'm out $10, two switches, that work the exact same way as the original non-illuminated switch. Save your money!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2024
reviews.title: A Dud Is A Dud Is A Dud...

reviews.text: Description say white but detail is clear/illuminated.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2024
reviews.title: Color

reviews.text: 1) The instructions and faceplate both indicate that right side up is with the green ground screw on the bottom right, but THIS IS NOT TRUE. The main photo on the amazon listing shows it right side up (with the green ground screw top left). I hope I can save someone else time and extra wiring. There is no "on" or "off" label on the switch anywhere. Flipping the switch makes a louder sound and is not as soft feeling as the standard switch I replaced. I prefer the softer, quieter style switch. I included a video for comparison. The regular switch turns on the fan, but hopefully you can still hear/see the difference. When I opened the box, only one of the long screws was attached. At first, I thought the second long screw was missing but then I found it and the plastic screw keeper in the bottom of the box. Just something to be aware of. I wish it only turned on the light when it was dark, but I knew when I bought it that it didn't have that capability. Other than that, it does exactly what I wanted it to do. I have two switches next to each other in the bathroom. I didn't want a night light; I just wanted to be able to find the light switch (and not the fan switch) in the evening without groping the wall, the switches, the blow dryer, etc.
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2024
reviews.title: IMPORTANT: Right side up is opposite of instructions

reviews.text: Let me shine a light on the Leviton Single Pole Illuminated Light Switch - it's like having a polite nightlight for your room! These switches are not just your run-of-the-mill light switches, they are the unsung heroes of my home. Installing these gems was a breeze - even I, a self-proclaimed DIY disaster, managed to do it without a hitch. The instructions were clear and easy to follow, and I had them up and running in a jiffy. The illuminated feature is just perfect - it's not a blinding light, but just enough to help me find the switch without stumbling around in the dark. And let's not forget about the price - these switches are a steal! You get premium quality and convenience without breaking the bank. It's like getting a VIP seat at a budget-friendly price - talk about a win-win! So, if you're tired of playing hide-and-seek with your light switches in the dark, do yourself a favor and grab a few of these Leviton Illuminated Light Switches. Your eyes (and your wallet) will thank you!
reviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.title: Light Up The Night!
